titleStmt.title: Dispatch from Frederick W. Seward to George G. L. Wright, January 22, 1862

bibl.title: Dispatch from Frederick W. Seward to George G. L. Wright, January 22, 1862
Despatches from United States Consuls in Gaboon, 1856-1888 T-466

div1.opener:
Department of State
Washington Jany 22nd, 1862
George G. L. Wright Esqr.
appointed United States Commercial Agent at the Gaboon
Sir:
div1.p: The President having appointed you Commercial Agent of the United States at the Gaboon.

I transmit you a printed copy of the Consular Regulations, to which your immediate and careful attention is invited: a form of the Consular bond, to be executed at once and sent to this Department, and other documents for the use of your Consulate, of which a list is subjoined.

As soon as your bond is recieved and approved your Passport will be transmitted to you, and your Certificate of appointment. Commission will be sent to the Legation of the United States at with instructions to apply to the Government for the usual Exequatus which when obtained, will be forwarded to you at with the Commission.

You will communicate to the Department the name of the State or County in which you were born, also of the State from which you have been appointed, and if you have ever visited in Gaboon. or any of its dependecies.
div1.closer:
I am sir respectfully,
Your obident servant,
T.W.Seward
Assistant Secretary
